intro: Obione occidentalis, commonly known as the western obione, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione occidentalis is considered a vulnerable species.
